templates.description: Authelia is an open-source authentication and authorization server and portal fulfilling the identity and access management (IAM) role of information security in providing multi-factor authentication and single sign-on (SSO) for your applications via a web portal. It acts as a companion for common reverse proxies.

templates.title: Code Server
templates.description: Code-Server is VS Code running on a remote server, accessible through the browser.
name: code-server

env.name: SUDO_PASSWORD
env.label: SUDO Password
env.description: If this optional variable is set, user will have sudo access in the code-server terminal with the specified password.

env.name: PASSWORD
env.label: Web GUI Password
env.description: Optional web gui password, if not provided, there will be no auth.

env.name: PROXY_DOMAIN
env.label: Proxy Domain
env.description: If this optional variable is set, this domain will be proxied for subdomain proxying.

templates.title: NOT-TESTED! DB Backup
templates.description: Backup Multiple DB Servers (Influx, Maria/Mysql/Mssql/Mongo/Postgres/Redis/Rethink) based on Alpine
name: db-backup

env.name: DB_TYPE
env.label: Database Type
env.description: Type of DB Server to backup

env.name: DB_NAME
env.label: Database Name
env.description: Schema Name (use 'all' if you want to backup all Databases).

env.name: DB_USER
env.label: Database Username
env.description: Username for the Database (use 'root' to backup all MySQL of them).

env.name: DB_PASS
env.label: Database Password
env.description: Password for the Database (optional if DB doesn't require it)

env.name: DB_PORT
env.label: Database Port
env.description: (optional) Set port to connect to DB_HOST. Defaults are provided

env.name: DB_DUMP_FREQ
env.label: Database dump Frequency
env.description: How often to do a dump, in minutes. Defaults to 1440 minutes, or once per day.

env.name: DB_DUMP_BEGIN
env.label: Database dump begin Time
env.description: What time to do the first dump. Defaults to immediate. Absolute HHMM, e.g. 2330 or 0415

env.name: DB_CLEANUP_TIME
env.label: Database cleanup Time
env.description: Value in minutes to delete old backups (only fired when dump freqency fires). 1440 would delete anything above 1 day old. You don't need to set this variable if you want to hold onto everything. (10080 = 1 Week)

env.name: COMPRESSION
env.label: Compression
env.description: Compression used to compress the backup file.

env.name: PARALLEL_COMPRESSION
env.label: Parallel Compression
env.description: Use multiple cores when compressing backups.

env.name: SPLIT_DB
env.label: Split Databases
env.description: If using root as username and multiple DBs on system, set to TRUE to create Seperate DB Backups instead of all in one.

env.name: DEBUG_MODE
env.label: Debug Mode
env.description: If set to true, print copious shell script messages to the container log. Otherwise only basic messages are printed.

templates.title: NOT-TESTED! Roundcube
templates.description: Roundcube webmail is a browser-based multilingual IMAP client with an application-like user interface.
name: roundcube

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_DEFAULT_HOST
env.label: IMAP Server
env.description: Hostname of the IMAP server to connect to. For encypted connections, prefix the host with tls:// (STARTTLS) or ssl:// (SSL/TLS).

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_SMTP_SERVER
env.label: SMTP Server
env.description: Hostname of the SMTP server to send mails. For encypted connections, prefix the host with tls:// (STARTTLS) or ssl:// (SSL/TLS).

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_PLUGINS
env.label: Roundcube Plugins
env.description: List of built-in plugins to activate.

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_SPELLCHECK_URI
env.label: Spellcheck URL
env.description: Fully qualified URL to a Google XML spell check API like google-spell-pspell

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_ASPELL_DICTS
env.label: Spellcheck dictionaries
env.description: List of aspell dictionaries to install for spell checking (comma-separated, e.g. de,fr,pl).

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_DB_TYPE
env.label: Database Type
env.description: Database provider; currently supported: mysql, pgsql, sqlite

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_DB_HOST
env.label: Database Host
env.description: Host (or Docker instance) name of the database service; defaults to mysql or postgres depending on linked containers.

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_DB_PORT
env.label: Database Port
env.description: Port number of the database service; defaults to 3306 or 5432 depending on linked containers.

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_DB_USER
env.label: Database User
env.description: The database username for Roundcube; defaults to root on mysql

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_DB_PASSWORD
env.label: Database Password
env.description: The password for the database connection.

env.name: ROUNDCUBEMAIL_DB_NAME
env.label: Database Name
env.description: The database name for Roundcube to use; defaults to roundcubemail

templates.title: NOT-TESTED! Speedtest Tracker
templates.description: This program runs a speedtest check every hour and graphs the results. The back-end is written in Laravel and the front-end uses React. It uses the speedtest-cli package to get the data and uses Chart.js to plot the results.
name: speedtest-tracker

env.name: AUTH
env.label: Authentication
env.description: Optional. Set to 'true' to enable authentication for the app

env.name: SLACK_WEBHOOK
env.label: Slack/Discord Webhook
env.description: Optional. Put a slack webhook here to get slack notifications when a speedtest is run. To use discord webhooks, just append /slack to the end of your discord webhook URL

env.name: OOKLA_EULA_GDPR
env.label: Ookla Eula
env.description: Set to 'true' to accept the Ookla EULA and privacy agreement. If this is not set, the container will not start

templates.title: NOT-TESTED! Speedtest Tracker 2
templates.description: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted internet performance tracking application that runs speedtest checks against Ookla's Speedtest service.
name: speedtest-tracker2

env.name: DB_CONNECTION
env.label: Database Type
env.description: Database provider; currently supported: mysql, pgsql

env.name: DB_PORT
env.label: Database Port
env.description: Port number of the database service; defaults to 3306 or 5432 depending on linked containers.

env.name: DB_DATABASE
env.label: Database Name
env.description: The database name for Speedtest-Tracker to use.

env.name: DB_USERNAME
env.label: Database User
env.description: The database username for Speedtest-tracker; defaults to root on mysql.

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.label: Database Password
env.description: Password for the Database (optional if DB doesn't require it)
